text: The 1791 English cricket season was the 20th in which matches have been awarded retrospective first-class cricket status and the fifth after the foundation of the Marylebone Cricket Club. The season saw 14 top-class matches played in the country. == Matches == A total of 14 top-class matches were played during the season.Association of Cricket Statisticians and Historians (ACS) (1981) A Guide to Important Cricket Matches Played in the British Isles 1709 – 1863. Nottingham: ACS.England Domestic Season 1791 - Results, CricInfo. Retrieved 2020-07-26.First-class matches in England, 1791, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2020-07-26. These included matches played by teams from Hampshire, Kent, Middlesex and Surrey as well as by club sides at Hornchurch in Essex and Brighton in Sussex. MCC played seven first-class matches. Other teams included England sides, the Gentlemen of Kent and Old Etonians. A number of matches below top-level were played, including the first by a team from Leicestershire.Other matches in England, 1791, CricketArchive. Retrieved 2020-07-26. ==First mentions== Players who made their first appearances in 1791 included Lord Frederick Beauclerk, who went on to be an influential, albeit controversial, figure in the development of MCC,Lord Frederick Beauclerk, CricInfo. Retrieved 2020-07-26. and Charles Cumberland. ==References== ==Further reading== * * * * Category:1791 in English cricket Category:English cricket seasons from 1787 to 1815
title: 1791 English cricket season
